neighbors.name: Donald Franz
neighbors.claims: Donald Franz is the owner of parcel 106-06-029A, located at 255 W Buffalo Ln in Huachuca City, according to county property records [LoopNet](https://www.loopnet.com/property/255-w-buffalo-ln-huachuca-city-az-85616/04003-10606029A/). He holds an active amateur radio license (Call Sign AA0Y) registered to this location [QRZCQ](https://www.qrzcq.com/call/AA0Y). No record of public comments on local development or zoning issues was found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one. As a private resident with technical interests (amateur radio), emphasize non-interference with signals and respect for privacy.

citations.title: 255 W Buffalo Ln Property Record

neighbors.name: Kenneth A. Bowen
neighbors.claims: Kenneth A. Bowen is listed as the owner of parcel 106-06-029D in Cochise County tax records [Cochise County Treasurer](https://parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov/Main/ParcelEntry). No public statements regarding renewable energy or land use development were identified for this individual in local media or public meeting minutes.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via informal outreach. Provide clear information and listen to any concerns, as he has no documented prior positions.

neighbors.name: John & Gail Christmann
neighbors.claims: John and Gail Christmann own parcel 106-06-018F (2059 W Cougar Pl) in Huachuca City [Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/AZ/Huachuca-City/2059-W-Cougar-Pl-85616/home/115029799). Gail Christmann is a member of the Sonoita/Elgin Preservation and Planning Committee, which advocates for local control over growth and preservation of rural character [Patagonia Regional Times](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/planning-committee-sets-april-29-town-hall-in-sonoita/). She also leads the local DarkSky certification initiative to limit light pollution [Patagonia Regional Times](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/citizen-committee-maps-new-planning-preservation-priorities-for-sonoita-elgin-area/). In 2021, Gail published a letter to the editor identifying herself as a "rancher and cattlewoman" and defending local beef production and water usage [Patagonia Regional Times](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/PRT-template-12.21-final.pdf). John Christmann is the founder of StarCrest Home Inspections and holds a Master's in Civil Engineering [StarCrest Home Inspections](https://starcresthomeinspections.com/about-us/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Gail is a Planning Committee member

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Gail as a community leader. Acknowledge her role on the Preservation Committee and DarkSky initiative. Frame project as compatible with rural character and water conservation.
